properties.name: Australian Museum
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum Wonderful natural-and-other history museum where I saw a replica of the Procoptodon goliah, a 3-meter tall carnivorous kangaroo from Australia\'s prehistoric times. Nightmarish.

properties.name: Carousel House at Battleship Cove
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum     The house containing Carousel #54 constructed by the Philadelphia Toboggan Company in 1920. Originally Located in Lincoln Park, North Dartmouth, MA.

properties.name: Commons Lunch
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum meeting house ln, little compton, riIt was closed in 2004 when it was struck by a fire, but it is scheduled to reopen very soon (possibly end of March 2006). Commons Lunch has always been the place to go for authentic Rhode Island jonnycakes.

properties.name: Darling Point
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentumsydney, auMy Dad\'s apartment buildign was here on this peninsula when I visited in \'99.

properties.name: Hyde Park
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum  A beautiful tree-lined park. The trees were large and gave the impression of arches. At night, the polished stone walkway reflected lights and the smooht-barked trees evoked creepy shadows.

properties.name: Hyundai Accident
properties.description: Posted by DrmomentumIn 1990, a woman pulled out of a bank parking lot and smacked right rear quarter of my Hyundai Excel as I was travelling westbound on President Ave. I spun 180 degrees from the impact and ended up in the far lane facing the opposite direction. She claimed not to have seen me coming. The officer called it an illegal start from a stopped position on her part. I never repaired the damage.

properties.name: Hyundai Accident 2
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentumburlington woods, burlington, maIn my first week of work at Xenergy around 1991 or so, there was a horrible ice storm in Burlington. The people who managed the office park failed to salt the roads despite there being a considerable hill southwest of this spot. As I entered the office park, I immediately began sliding down the hill with zero control At the bottom of the hill I slammed into a light pole. Only slightly dazed, I tried to get out of the car and found that the road was so slick I couldn\'t gain footing. I slipped and fell when I exited the car. An onlooker saw me crash, and then fall, and promptly ran away without so much as an "are you OK?" I was able to start the car, even though the front was severely dented. Somehow, I got the car into a space in a parking lot. But when I carefully exited the car and closed the driver\'s door, the car immediately began sliding sideways across the parking lod down a gradual slope. It eventually came to a gentle rest against another car, and I had to physically push it back into its space.

properties.name: Joseph & Affie Shaker Monument
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum "On this site, Joseph & Affie Shaker raised a family, developed a thriving business and gave to their community love and friendship. In their memory and in honor of all their descendents, we dedicate this monument. \'Shoukran\' - May 1, 1988"

properties.name: McDonalds - a job from the early 80's
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum I worked here with my friend BriWei and my cousin Bill in the early 80\'s. At that time, they would put one\'s name out on a chalk board announcing who was the "biscuit chef" for the day. On the weekends, I had the singular honor to bake the buttermilk biscuits from (almost) scratch. I don\'t know if they actually prepare the biscuits in-store anymore.

properties.name: Newport Dinner Train
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentumamerica\'s cup ave, newport, riThe station where you can catch a ride on the Dinner Train or take the daytime train ride.

properties.name: Sachuest Point
properties.description: Posted by DrmomentumRocks off the shoreline of Sachuest Point. Sachuest Point is a national wildlife refuge. Various species of ducks can be found here, as well as many other marine animals.

properties.name: The Rocks
properties.description: Posted by DrmomentumVisited here with Dad in 1999 to enjoy a pint in a wonderful Irish pub. Visited Circular Quay and wandered the Rocks Marketplace. Satisfied a craving for corn on a stick, which we ate sitting on the street corner with tourists and locals.

properties.name: Trinity Brewhouse
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum  186 Fountain St., Providence, RI.The Trinity Brewhouse is a great little pub/restaurant just within walking distance of the Providence Place Mall. Great IPA. Also, I the pulled pork sandwich and wings are worth a try.

properties.name: UMI Japanese Steakhouse
properties.description: Posted by Drmomentum Great Japanese steakhouse. Sushi and hibachi.
